Writing Better Issues for Better Fixes:\n   - Include error messages: Copy the full stack trace\n   - Specify the file/function: \"Fix pagination in UserList.js\"\n   - Describe expected behavior: \"Should show 10 users per page\"\n   - Add context: \"This broke after upgrading to React 18\"\n\n2. Security-First Fixes:\n   RSOLV automatically scans for:\n   - SQL injection vulnerabilities\n   - Cross-site scripting (XSS) risks\n   - Authentication/authorization issues\n   - Insecure dependencies\n   - Hardcoded secrets or API keys\n\n3. Security-First Fixes:\n   RSOLV automatically scans for:\n   - SQL injection vulnerabilities\n   - Cross-site scripting (XSS) risks\n   - Authentication/authorization issues\n   - Insecure dependencies\n   - Hardcoded secrets or API keys\n\n3. Security-First Fixes:\n   RSOLV automatically scans for:\n   - SQL injection vulnerabilities\n   - Cross-site scripting (XSS) risks\n   - Authentication/authorization issues\n   - Insecure dependencies\n   - Hardcoded secrets or API keys\n\n3. 13:17:05.036 [debug] QUERY OK db=0.7ms queue=0.1ms
SELECT column_name FROM information_schema.columns 
                                         WHERE table_name = 'repositories' 
                                         AND column_name IN ('namespace', 'name', 'full_path') []
13:17:05.045 [debug] QUERY OK db=8.0ms queue=0.3ms

        SELECT 
          tc.constraint_name,
          tc.table_name,
          kcu.column_name,
          ccu.table_name AS foreign_table_name
        FROM information_schema.table_constraints AS tc 
        JOIN information_schema.key_column_usage AS kcu
          ON tc.constraint_name = kcu.constraint_name
        JOIN information_schema.constraint_column_usage AS ccu
          ON ccu.constraint_name = tc.constraint_name
        WHERE tc.constraint_type = 'FOREIGN KEY' 
          AND tc.table_name IN ('forge_accounts', 'repositories', 'scan_executions', 
                                'validation_executions', 'mitigation_executions')
       []
13:17:05.045 [debug] QUERY OK db=0.0ms
SELECT typname FROM pg_type WHERE typname IN ('forge_type', 'execution_status') []

Writing Better Issues for Better Fixes:\n   - Include error messages: Copy the full stack trace\n   - Specify the file/function: \"Fix pagination in UserList.js\"\n   - Describe expected behavior: \"Should show 10 users per page\"\n   - Add context: \"This broke after upgrading to React 18\"\n\n2. Security-First Fixes:\n   RSOLV automatically scans for:\n   - SQL injection vulnerabilities\n   - Cross-site scripting (XSS) risks\n   - Authentication/authorization issues\n   - Insecure dependencies\n   - Hardcoded secrets or API keys\n\n3. Batch Processing:\n   Tag multiple issues with \"rsolv:automate\" and RSOLV creates separate PRs for each.\n\n4. Here are some advanced features and techniques:\n\n1. Writing Better Issues for Better Fixes:\n   - Include error messages: Copy the full stack trace\n   - Specify the file/function: \"Fix pagination in UserList.js\"\n   - Describe expected behavior: \"Should show 10 users per page\"\n   - Add context: \"This broke after upgrading to React 18\"\n\n2. Security-First Fixes:\n   RSOLV automatically scans for:\n   - SQL injection vulnerabilities\n   - Cross-site scripting (XSS) risks\n   - Authentication/authorization issues\n   - Insecure dependencies\n   - Hardcoded secrets or API keys\n\n3. Batch Processing:\n   Tag multiple issues with \"rsolv:automate\" and RSOLV creates separate PRs for each.\n\n4. Customizing RSOLV Behavior:\n   Add these tags to your issues:\n   - [performance] - Optimize for speed\n   - [security] - Extra security focus\n   - [minimal] - Smallest possible change\n   - [refactor] - Clean up while fixing\n\nComing Soon:\n- Support for more languages (Go, Rust, PHP)\n- Custom fix preferences per repository\n- Team collaboration features\n- Integration with more platforms\n\nHave a feature request? Writing Better Issues for Better Fixes:\n   - Include error messages: Copy the full stack trace\n   - Specify the file/function: \"Fix pagination in UserList.js\"\n   - Describe expected behavior: \"Should show 10 users per page\"\n   - Add context: \"This broke after upgrading to React 18\"\n\n2. Security-First Fixes:\n   RSOLV automatically scans for:\n   - SQL injection vulnerabilities\n   - Cross-site scripting (XSS) risks\n   - Authentication/authorization issues\n   - Insecure dependencies\n   - Hardcoded secrets or API keys\n\n3. Here are some advanced features and techniques:\n\n1. Writing Better Issues for Better Fixes:\n   - Include error messages: Copy the full stack trace\n   - Specify the file/function: \"Fix pagination in UserList.js\"\n   - Describe expected behavior: \"Should show 10 users per page\"\n   - Add context: \"This broke after upgrading to React 18\"\n\n2. Security-First Fixes:\n   RSOLV automatically scans for:\n   - SQL injection vulnerabilities\n   - Cross-site scripting (XSS) risks\n   - Authentication/authorization issues\n   - Insecure dependencies\n   - Hardcoded secrets or API keys\n\n3. Batch Processing:\n   Tag multiple issues with \"rsolv:automate\" and RSOLV creates separate PRs for each.\n\n4. Customizing RSOLV Behavior:\n   Add these tags to your issues:\n   - [performance] - Optimize for speed\n   - [security] - Extra security focus\n   - [minimal] - Smallest possible change\n   - [refactor] - Clean up while fixing\n\nComing Soon:\n- Support for more languages (Go, Rust, PHP)\n- Custom fix preferences per repository\n- Team collaboration features\n- Integration with more platforms\n\nHave a feature request? Writing Better Issues for Better Fixes:\n   - Include error messages: Copy the full stack trace\n   - Specify the file/function: \"Fix pagination in UserList.js\"\n   - Describe expected behavior: \"Should show 10 users per page\"\n   - Add context: \"This broke after upgrading to React 18\"\n\n2. --------------------------------------------------
